original_definition: 'biomass fuel' means a gaseous or liquid fuel produced from biomass;
generated_definition: 'biomass fuel' means a type of fuel derived from organic matter, such as wood, agricultural waste, or other renewable sources, that is used to generate heat or electricity.

Article 2: ‘biomass fuel’ means a gaseous or liquid fuel produced from biomass;
Article 8: ‘heat pumpspace heater’, for the purposes of Figures 1 and 3 in Annex IV referred to as ‘heat pump’, means a space heater using ambient heat from an air source, water source or ground source, and/or waste heat for heat generation; a heat pump space heater may be equipped with one or more supplementary heaters using the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements or the combustion of fossil and/orbiomass fuels;

‘heat pump space heater’, for the purposes of Figures 1 and 3 in Annex IV referred to as ‘heat pump’, means a space heater using ambient heat from an air source, water source or ground source, and/or waste heat for heat generation; a heat pump space heater may be equipped with one or more supplementary heaters using the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements or the combustion of fossil and/or biomass fuels;
